name: The Royal Caribbean

reviews.text: Was at the Caribbean Jan 7-14. Exceptional service without being pushy. Italian Seafood Buffet on Wednesday night was a Highlight. The tennis pro, Ignatio, is excellent at a reasonable price for lessons. The beach is gorgeous and beautifully maintained. Maid service in each Villa is to write home about.You can cook in each villa to cut down on expenses. Each resort has its own grocery store that is reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Royal Caribbean Resort Vacation

reviews.text: We ALWAYS have a great experience at ANY Royal resort. The staff is extremely helpful and always ready to assist you with anything you need. The staff remembers your name and cannot do enough to help you. We have never had a bad experience at the Royal CArribean and go there as often as possible. For a resort to be so constant in their reliability says a lot!!
reviews.title: We love it there!!

reviews.text: We just returned from an absolutely perfect weeklong vacation in Cancun at The Royal Caribbean. My boyfriend and I took his 3 girls, ages 10, 9, and 5 between Christmas and New Years - and could not have been more pleased. I did a lot of research on TA prior to booking this property, since I wanted to make sure there was plenty to do for the kids. And there was!
reviews.title: Amazing property for family vacation

reviews.text: To start - we booked transportation from the airport through Thomas Moore Travel Agency (the onsite agency at the Royal properties). Very efficient, reasonably priced- and had a private van for 5 of us that took us right to the property (about 15 min from the airport).
reviews.title: A Cruise Ship Vacation, ......On Land

reviews.text: They checked us in early and we were able to go right to our villa - which was amazing! We arrived Mon - and since the property rents Sat-Sat, we stayed our 1st 5 days in the F building (F821). Gorgeous view of the pool AND ocean. HUGE rooms. The villas are set up so there is a common area with TV, kitchen, dining table, and even 2 pulldown beds from the entertainment center if needed. This opens onto a beautiful, large balcony with dining table and lounge chairs. The girls had their own "wing", with 2 queen size beds, large walk in closet, and bathroom. We had a similar set up in our "wing" with a king bed and sliders that opened onto the balcony. Plenty of space and privacy for everyone. Units even came with ironing board and iron which I thought was a nice addition if needed. Although I was told otherwise, - they DO provide bar soap for the bathroom, hairdryer, as well as a "welcome" gift through your personal concierge of shampoo, and lotion - though we brought our own.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mlost beautiful hotel in Cancun. Fantastic room. Amazing grounds and incredible view of the sea. Fanstastic staff.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Cancun

reviews.text: This place is absolutely great! The location, the food, the service and staff, and the amenities are awesome. Everyone we encountered was friendly, polite, and willing to help. There is a concierge assigned to each villa to assist with booking tours, making reservations for restaurants and entertainment, and anything else needed to make your holiday a great one. The villa was exceptionally clean and well maintained. The food choices are numerous, a key factor for people desiring not to eat meat. There are also off-property food choices within walking distance as well as some just a short bus ride away. Shopping is nearby, choose from one of the high-end malls, or the flea market (great place for bartering on prices for some really good silver.)
reviews.title: Best place in CUN that i've stayed so far!

reviews.text: Ok, I will share what I feel most readers will appreciate when planning a vacation and considering a property for such.
reviews.title: Solid Vacation, 4 Star of 5

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: 1) The beach. Cannot go wrong. Be sure to wade beyond the first drop off, to the 2nd @ about 4 feet, and rake the bottom with feet...you will find great shells. They require some work but it pays off. Be careful of surf. (see photos.) 2) The kitchen. To have one is nice. Very clean. 3) Cleanliness. 4) Balcony. 5) Pottery/painting in the craft area next to the sports center. A must-do -- you pick the item, paint it, and they "fix it" overnight with detialing and gloss. 6) Tempature control. We had a full villa and one side preferred warmer, one side colder. No problem. 7) on site car rental. Fast, efficient, and safe. 8) Extra blankets in suite. 9) Housekeeping. Awesome. We tipped $20 twice and she was awesome. 10) Coffee shop. 11) Gift shop. 12) Trip to Akumal, car rental, snorkeling at Xel-Ha lagoon, La Buena Vida Restaurant in Akumal. AWESOME. We go each year. 13) Safe in room. 14) Ability for each person in party to have individual "cards" to allow charges to be itemized. 15) Valet and bell crew. Very thougtful, hard working and kind. 16) Pool. Clean, and kids area seemed GREAT for little ones. 17) The fact the market has lots of good, fresh food and liquor, allowing us to avoid a Walmart trip.
reviews.title: Welcome to paradise

reviews.text: Cons: 1) slow wifi. Slow on all devices -- not user error. 2) Slow service pool and beach side. We found ourselves bringing food and booze from suite to relax as service took a LONG time. We paid well -- we wanted to tip someone -- but 1 or 2 servers working the whole area each day?? Not good. 3) El Conquistador at the Royal Mayan next door -- steaks were bad, and 2 of 4 were sick same night. 4) Concierge. They are really just timeshare reps hoping to sell you a week. Just day no thank you and STOP CALLING, or they will call your suite each morning.
reviews.title: Royal caribbean Cancun excellent stay on the beach

reviews.text: My family has been visiting the Royal Resorts since 1990. We love coming back year after year. We have timeshares in both the Royal Caribbean and Royal Islander. The units are always immaculately clean and the staff goes out of their way to serve everyone. The beach is beautiful and the pool area is very clean. The pool staff is terrific. Pedro is our favorite! He remembers us year after year! This is a good place for families or people looking for a quiet spot. The food at each of the resort restaurants is good. They have pizza delivery within the resort if you feel like staying in for the evening. You will not be diappointed!
reviews.title: Like coming home year after year
Very nice but bland depending on your taste
reviews.text: I've stayed at the Royal Caribbean, Royal Mayan, Royal Islander and Royal Cancun (formerly Club International Cancun). They are all part of the Royal Resorts and are primarily timeshares - my parents have 3 weeks each year. In terms of service and quality of rooms, they are all fairly equal so choose based on other factors.

Out of the four, I like the Cancun the best and the Mayan the second best. The Cancun is on the bay side and is much smaller, quieter and the ocean is calm (so great for kids or elderly parents). The Caribbean, Mayan and Islander are right next to each other on the ocean side. Out of the three, the Mayan is the prettiest and has a great palapa restaurant/bar.
reviews.title: Love the friendship

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you really want to go to Cancun, all four are great places to stay. The beaches and water are beautiful. If you are looking for an authentic Mexican experience, don't go to Cancun, period. Cancun caters to tourists (primarily from US and Europe) and is has gotten very expensive in the last 15 years relative to other Central American destinations. Also, very few people of color seem to vacation there.
reviews.title: Wonderful Cancun vacation spot...I'll go back again!

reviews.text: Quick note, the beachfront massages with Monica at the Mayan are the best!!
reviews.title: Awesome Trip!

reviews.text: We had stayed at the Royal Islander back in 1999 and decided to return this year for a family vacation. We were not disappointed at all! We had a full 2-bedroom villa at the Royal Caribbean which was perfect for our family of 5: master bedroom with king bed and own bathroom, 2nd bedroom with 2 double beds and own bathroom, full kitchen, full living room with 2 Murphy beds, large balcony with full patio set. You would be hard pressed to find something so spacious at any other resort.
reviews.title: Awesome Getaway

reviews.text: Everything on the resort is immaculate and all staff is extremely friendly. You have access to all facilities of the 3 side-by-side resorts (Islander, Caribbean, Mayan) as well as the other 2 resorts in Cancun (Sands, Club International).
reviews.title: Consistently Delivers

reviews.text: We took the bus to Wal-Mart in downtown Cancun to do some groceries, mostly for breakfasts and lunches. It's much cheaper than buying your food at the resort's convenience store.
reviews.title: Perfect Getaway

reviews.text: We tried a few of the resort restaurants for dinner: Paco Taco's and The Palapa (casual Mexican), Tradewinds, and Captain's Cove (fine Seafood and Steak). All restaurants were very good but a bit pricey, especially the drinks and desserts.
reviews.title: Fantastic but a few tiny quibbles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We do have 2 minor complaints:
reviews.title: Wonderful as always!!!!

description: Escape to paradise. Sink your toes into the soft white sand and surrender to the caress of the warm breeze in your own Cancun hideaway. An enchanting beachfront setting, spacious villas, five-star services and friendly ambiance, make The Royal Caribbean a heavenly spot for relaxing and reconnecting with family and friends.
